author: Megan Ellis
title: The world's least crowded countries
text:
The world's least crowded countries Article By: Megan Ellis Wed, 09 Sep 2015 11:39 AM Share Your Email A church in Greenland. Credit: pixabay.com 
We've written about the world's most crowded countries, but what about those countries where you get your fair share of space? 
We have a list of the world's least crowded countries, based on World Bank data and other information on each country's population density. 
The title of the country with the lowest population density goes to Greenland. 
Considering Monaco has 19 033 people per square kilometre, Greenland seems virtually empty with a population density of only 0.14 people per square kilometre. 
That's right, less than one person per square kilometre. 
In second place is Mongolia, with only two people per square kilometre. 
Two Southern African countries make the top ten list - Namibia and Botswana. 
Have a look at the top ten least crowded countries below, with the rounded figures given by the World Bank: 1. Greenland - 0.14 people per square kilometre 2. Mongolia - 2 people per square kilometre 3. Namibia - 3 people per square kilometre 4. Australia - 3 people per square kilometre 5. Iceland - 3 people per square kilometre 6. Suriname - 3 people per square kilometre 7. Libya - 4 people per square kilometre 8. Botswana - 4 people per square kilometre 9. Mauritania - 4 people per square kilometre 10. Canada - 4 people per square kilometre
